content.description:
An oil storage tank has the shape as shown above, obtained by revolving the curveÂ <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>9</mn> <mrow> <mn>625</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CEE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> from x=0 to x=5 about the y-axis, where x and y are measured in feet.

Oil flows into the tank at the constant rate of 8 cubic feet per minute.
content.question: Let h be the depth, in feet, of oil in the tank. How fast is the depth of oil in the tank increasing when h = 4 ? Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: Let h be the depth, in feet, of oil in the tank. How fast is the depth of oil in the tank increasing when h = 4 ? Indicate units of measure.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
